div.l: And in the flore with nose ⁊and mouth to broke
Thei walowe as doth two piggis in a poke
And vp thei gon ⁊and down agayn a non
Till that the Miller spurned at a ston
And down he fill bakwarde vp on his wif
That wist no thyng of this nyce strif
For sche was falle a slepe a litill wight
With Iohn the clerk that waked had all the nyght
And with the fall out of hir slepe sche braide
Helpe holi crosse of Bromholm sche saide
In manꝰus tuas lord to thee I calle
A wake Symond the fende is on me falle
Myn herte is broken help I nam but ded
Ther lith oon vp my wombe ⁊and vp on on myn heed
Helpe Symken for the fals clerkis fighte
This Iohn sterte vp as faste as euyr he myght
And graspede bi the walles to ⁊and fro
To fynden a staf ⁊and sche sterte vp also
And knewe the estris bet than dide that Iohn
And bi the wall a staf sche fonde a non
And sawȝ a litill schymeryng of a light
For at an hole in schone the mone bright
And bi that light sche saugh hem bothe two
But sikerly sche nyste ho was who
But as sche saugh a white thyng in hir ye
And whan sche gan this white thyng aspye
Sche wende the clerk had werid a volipere
And with the staf sche drough ay nere ⁊and nere
And wende han hitte this Aleyn atte fulle
And smote the Miller on the piled sculle
That down he goth ⁊and criede harrow I dye
These clerkis bete hym well ⁊and lete hym lye
And greithen hem ⁊and toke here hors a non
And ek her mele ⁊and on here weie thei gon
And atte Mille yet thei toke her cake
Of half a buschell flour full well bake
Thus is the proude Miller well bete
And hath loste the gryndyng of the whete
And paied for the soꝑpere eủery dele
Of Aleyn ⁊and of Iohn that bete hym wele
His wif is swyued ⁊and his doughter als
Lo suche it is a Miller to be fals
And therfore this ꝓprouerbe is seide full soth noᵃta
Hym thar not wene well that euyll doth
A gilour schall hym self bigiled be
And god that sitteth hye in mageste
Saue all this companye grete ⁊and smale
